alert.note: Alert for Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 21 at 8:44AM PST until January 22 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong north to east winds through Saturday... .North to east winds will increase across interior Northern California today. The strongest winds in the Central Valley will occur this afternoon into Saturday morning, while strongest winds over the northern Sierra and southern Cascades are expected tonight and Saturday. Gusts of 30 to 45 mph are likely in the Central Valley, locally higher along the west side and Delta area. Gusts of 50 to 70 mph, locally higher, are likely across the higher elevations and exposed ridges in the northern Sierra. The most significant impacts are expected in the mountains where downed trees and power outages will be possible along with difficult driving conditions. ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph, locally higher along the west side of the Sacramento Valley and Delta areas. * WHERE...Northern San Joaquin Valley, Carquinez Strait and Delta, Central and Southern Sacramento Valley. * WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 7 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs and weakened trees could be blown down and a few power outages may result. Travel could be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Avoid forested areas as gusty winds could blow down trees and branches. Stay clear of power lines. Secure outdoor objects.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Carquinez Strait and Delta; Central Sacramento Valley; Northern San Joaquin Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley
